reasoning: Absence seizure disorder (generalized epilepsy) incidence estimated at ~2.3 per 100k person-years from epidemiological studies. This represents the incident rate of new-onset absence seizure/absence epilepsy diagnoses, primarily in childhood. Confidence reflects moderate-quality epidemiological evidence from multiple regional studies.
source: Camfield CS et al. (2002). The epidemiology of childhood epilepsy in the Netherlands. Epilepsia. 43(12):1501-1506
